text: Preheat the oven to 375°F or 190°C.  Prepare the baking sheets. They can either be lined with parchment paper, or lightly oiled. Combine all dry ingredients in a medium mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Combine egg and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Beat with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add the butter to the egg and sugar mixture. Beat on high speed until well combined. Add the peppermint extract. Beat lightly. Add the dry ingredient mixture. Mix again, until combined. Add any optional ingredients. Mix again. Drop egg sized balls onto the prepared baking sheets for larger cookies. For smaller cookies, use walnut sized balls. Leave at least 2 inches (5.1 cm) between the cookies, as they flatten during baking. Bake in the preheated oven. Usually 8-11 minutes, you can tell they are done when the cookies are golden brown around the edges, and no longer look 'wet' in the middle. Cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheets. Then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Finished.
